title: How to write an email to a client for an order - Quora

response.answer_text: Dear xyz Greetings of the day from abc company. Write the context of discussion you may have had on the phone or in person. or Write what you know about the company and why you think they can benefit from your product. This will be a reiteration of what you may have spoken earlier with the client. Give all supporting pictures, facts and quotes and anything else that will help him make a decision on placing the order. End the letter with: Do reach out to us for any queries that we can help you with, to assist your decision-making on the orders. We’d be happy to help you with any other information that can benefit you and your clients. Any such ending line without fancy, but polite and assertive too. Hope this helps

1. Describe your company profile with contact details 2. Mention history of dealing with the product or of the service the client is looking for alongwith success stories and letters of accreditation, if any.3. Mention your USP in the mail 4. Quote a price stating that it is open to negotiation(even if it isn’t). 5.Be prompt in replying to all their queries 6.Keep in touch with the client even if you lose the business.This will pave your way for further business from him or his contacts 7.Use bold fonts or underscore in the body of the mail to stress on the selling points wherever necessary.
